simple.name: Claude Code GUI Mode
simple.description: Operates as a graphical interface for Claude Code. Uses Claude Code as the execution backend with simplified task input.

expert.name: Standalone Orchestration Mode
expert.description: Full orchestration with PRD generation, multi-agent coordination, and advanced execution strategies. Requires LLM API configuration.

theme.title: Theme
theme.description: Choose your preferred color scheme. System follows your OS preference.

llm.title: LLM Backend
llm.description: Select your preferred LLM provider and configure API access.

claude-code.name: Claude Code (Claude Max)
claude-code.description: Use Claude Code as LLM backend. No API key required.

qwen.name: Qwen (DashScope)
qwen.description: 阿里云通义千问 Qwen models.

minimax.name: MiniMax
minimax.description: MiniMax M2 series models with reasoning support.

apiKey.label: API Key
apiKey.title: API Key for {{name}}
apiKey.placeholderConfigured: API key is configured (click eye icon to reveal)

glmEndpoint.label: API Region & Endpoint
glmEndpoint.help: Select the endpoint matching your GLM account region and plan. China endpoints are for keys registered on open.bigmodel.cn, International endpoints are for keys registered on z.ai.

standard.name: China — Standard
standard.description: General-purpose API endpoint for most GLM plans (open.bigmodel.cn).

coding.name: China — Coding
coding.description: Dedicated endpoint for GLM Coding plans on the China platform.

international.name: International — Standard
international.description: General-purpose API endpoint for the international platform (z.ai).

international-coding.name: International — Coding
international-coding.description: Dedicated endpoint for GLM Coding plans on the international platform (z.ai).

qwenEndpoint.label: API Region
qwenEndpoint.help: Select the endpoint matching your Qwen API key region. China keys only work with the China endpoint. International keys work with Singapore or US endpoints.

china.name: China (Beijing)
china.description: For API keys registered on the China platform (dashscope.aliyuncs.com).

singapore.name: International (Singapore)
singapore.description: For API keys registered on the international platform (dashscope-intl.aliyuncs.com).

us.name: International (US - Virginia)
us.description: For API keys registered on the US platform (dashscope-us.aliyuncs.com).

minimaxEndpoint.label: API Region
minimaxEndpoint.help: Select the endpoint matching your MiniMax API key region. China keys only work with the China endpoint, and vice versa.

international.name: International
international.description: For API keys registered on the international platform (minimax.io).

china.name: China
china.description: For API keys registered on the China platform (minimaxi.com).

model.label: Model
model.help: Choose a built-in model from the dropdown, or add your own custom model.

contextTurns.label: Conversation Context Turns
contextTurns.help: Simple mode standalone backends keep the latest N conversation turns as context.

contextManagement.label: Context Management
contextManagement.compactionHelp: When the conversation context grows too large, automatically summarize older messages to stay within the token budget. This prevents execution failures from context overflow during long analysis tasks.

streaming.label: Streaming Output
streaming.subAgentEventsHelp: Display structured start/end events for delegated exploration and analysis phases.
streaming.reasoningTracesHelp: Off by default. Enable only for debugging verbose model behavior.
streaming.enableThinkingHelp: Enable extended thinking for supported models (Qwen3, QwQ, DeepSeek-R1, etc.). The model will reason through problems step-by-step before responding.

searchProvider.label: Web Search Provider
searchProvider.help: Search provider for the WebSearch tool. Tavily and Brave require API keys (configure above under their respective provider names).

agents.title: Agent Configuration
agents.description: Configure execution agents and their selection strategy.
agents.name: Agent Name
agents.commandHelp: The CLI command to invoke this agent
agents.emptyState: No agents configured. Add an agent to get started.

selection.title: Agent Selection Strategy
selection.smartDescription: AI will choose the best agent for each task type.
selection.preferDefaultDescription: Always use the default agent unless overridden.
selection.manualDescription: You will be prompted to select an agent for each task.

dialog.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete "{{name}}"? This action cannot be undone.

quality.title: Quality Gates
quality.description: Configure quality checks that must pass before a story is marked complete.

typecheck.label: Type Check
typecheck.description: Run type checking (mypy, pyright, tsc) before considering a story complete.

test.label: Tests
test.description: Run tests (pytest, jest, npm test) to verify functionality.

lint.label: Lint
lint.description: Run linting (ruff, eslint) to ensure code quality.

custom.label: Custom Script
custom.description: Run a custom quality check script.

customScript.label: Custom Script
customScript.help: Enter a script or command to run. Exit code 0 means success.

retry.label: Retry Settings
retry.help: Number of times to retry a story if quality gates fail (0-10).

summary.label: Summary
summary.noGates: No quality gates enabled. Stories will be marked complete without validation.
summary.mustPass: Stories must pass {{gates}} to be considered complete. {{retryMessage}}
summary.retryMessage: If gates fail, the agent will retry up to {{count}} time.
summary.retryMessage_plural: If gates fail, the agent will retry up to {{count}} times.

phases.title: Phase Agent Assignment
phases.description: Assign default agents and fallback chains to each execution phase.

fallback.title: Fallback Chain Configuration
fallback.help: If the default agent fails, agents will be tried in order until one succeeds.

info.title: How Phase Assignment Works
info.description: Each execution phase can be assigned a default agent. If that agent fails or is unavailable, the system will try agents from the fallback chain in order. This allows for robust multi-agent orchestration with graceful degradation.

importExport.title: Import & Export
importExport.description: Backup your settings or transfer them to another installation. Exports include all frontend and backend settings.

export.title: Export Settings
export.description: Download all settings (frontend + backend) as a JSON file. Optionally include encrypted API keys.
export.error: Failed to export settings. Please try again.

import.title: Import Settings
import.description: Import settings from a previously exported JSON file. Supports both v5.x and v6.0 formats.
import.dialogDescription: This will overwrite your current settings. Are you sure you want to continue?
import.error: Failed to import settings. Please try again.
import.partialSuccess: Import completed with some warnings or errors. Check the details.
import.parseError: Failed to parse settings file. Please ensure it is valid JSON.
import.wrongPassword: Wrong password: failed to decrypt API keys.
import.legacyFormatNote: This is a legacy v5.x format. Only frontend settings will be imported. Backend settings are not included in this format.

password.label: Password
password.hint: This password encrypts your API keys. You will need it when importing on another machine.

reset.title: Reset to Defaults
reset.description: This will reset all settings to their default values. This action cannot be undone.
reset.error: Failed to reset settings. Please try again.

embedding.title: Embedding Provider
embedding.description: Configure the embedding provider used for codebase indexing and semantic search.

tf_idf.description: Local TF-IDF vectorization. No external dependencies. Fast but less semantic.

ollama.description: Local embedding via Ollama. Requires Ollama running with an embedding model pulled.

qwen.description: Qwen embedding models via Alibaba DashScope API. Requires API key.

glm.description: GLM embedding models via ZhipuAI API. Requires API key.

open_ai.description: OpenAI embedding models (text-embedding-3-small, etc.). Requires API key.

apiKey.title: API Key for {{name}}
apiKey.saveError: Failed to save embedding API key
apiKey.help: Stored securely in OS keyring with alias "{{alias}}". Separate from LLM provider API keys.

model.label: Model
model.help: Enter the embedding model identifier. Leave blank to use the provider's default model.

baseUrl.label: Base URL
baseUrl.help: Override the default API endpoint. Required for custom Ollama hosts.

dimension.label: Embedding Dimension
dimension.help: The output vector dimension. Some providers support multiple dimensions.

batchSize.label: Batch Size
batchSize.help: Number of texts per embedding request. Max: {{max}}.

fallback.label: Fallback Provider
fallback.help: If the primary provider fails, fall back to this provider.

reindex.title: Reindex Required
reindex.message: The embedding provider or model changed. A full reindex of the codebase is recommended to use the new embeddings.

lsp.title: LSP Language Servers
lsp.description: Configure language server detection and semantic enrichment for enhanced code intelligence.

enrichment.title: Enrichment Settings
enrichment.autoEnrichHelp: Automatically run LSP enrichment after Tree-sitter indexing completes. Adds type information, cross-references, and call graphs.
enrichment.noServers: No servers detected — run detection first

info.title: About LSP Enrichment
info.description: LSP enrichment is optional and enhances the Tree-sitter index with type information, cross-references, and call graphs from detected language servers. It runs as a post-processing pass after indexing.

plugins.title: Plugins
plugins.description: Claude Code-compatible plugins with skills, commands, and hooks.

empty.title: No plugins discovered.
empty.description: Place plugins in your project's .claude-plugin/ directory, ~/.claude/plugins/cache/, or ~/.plan-cascade/plugins/.

plugins.installFromUrlDesc: Enter the git URL of a Claude Code plugin repository to install it.
plugins.invalidGitUrl: URL must start with https://, http://, or git@
plugins.uninstallConfirm: Are you sure you want to uninstall "{{name}}"?
plugins.uninstallDesc: This will remove the plugin from your system.
plugins.addMarketplaceDesc: Enter a GitHub repository (owner/repo), Git URL, or local path
plugins.invalidMarketplace: Could not find a valid marketplace.json

security.title: Security Guardrails
security.description: Configure content validation rules that protect against sensitive data leaks and code security issues.

custom.title: Custom Rules
custom.addFailed: Failed to add rule. Check the regex pattern.

network.title: Network Settings
network.description: Configure HTTP proxy for LLM and embedding provider connections.

webhook.title: Notifications
webhook.description: Configure webhook channels to receive notifications when tasks complete or fail.

telegram.title: Telegram Bot Configuration
telegram.chatIdHint: Leave empty to allow all chats.
telegram.userIdHint: Leave empty to allow all users.

errors.noActiveSession: No active session for this chat
errors.maxReconnectExceeded: Maximum reconnect attempts exceeded. Please restart the gateway manually.

webhookIntegration.webhookDispatched: Webhook notification sent for remote command

a2a.title: Remote A2A Agents
a2a.description: Discover and register remote agents via the Agent-to-Agent (A2A) protocol. Registered agents can be used in Agent Composer pipelines.
a2a.noAgents: No remote agents registered. Enter a URL above to discover and register one.
